cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the north-central Gulf toward southeastern Louisiana, then slowing and turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Louisiana coast, Mississippi coast, and portions of coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds (50–70+ kt) likely at the port Sunday night into Monday with higher gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels on the Lower Mississippi River near Baton Rouge could rise several feet due to Gulf surge funneling through Lake Maurepas and the river system; localized overtopping of levees is possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–18 inches, locally up to 24 inches, producing life-threatening flash, urban, and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; prolonged power outages; navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River due to high water and debris.
